item.title: Writing a Geometric Solver in Python - Part 1: Modelling Constraints
item.description: PySketcher is little library which I maintain which makes it simple (hopefully) to draw geometric images. It was originally written by Hans Petter Langtangen, who sadly passed away in 2016, and since 2019 I’ve been keeping it up to date and adding features. Right now, PySketcher only supports absolute positioning of shapes. This means that you have to know exactly where you’d like the center of your circle to be and exactly what radius it should have.
